Package org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.safra

Class SafraConverter

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.safra.SafraConverter
public class SafraConverter
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides an implementation of the Safra's determinization algorithm [S. Safra, On the complexity of omega-automta. In Proc. 29th IEEE Symp. on Foundations of Computer Science, 1988, pp. 319-327] and also modified Safra's determinization algorithm in [Althoff, Thomas, and Wallmeier. Observations on determinization of Büchi automata. Theoretical Computer Science, '06]. This class also offers a modified version of Safra's construction. In Safra's construction, the evolution of a Safra tree follows the four steps: spawning child nodes, moving states one-step forward, removing a state that occurs in an older sibling, and removing empty nodes and nodes with label same as the union of the labels of its children. In the modified version, like the Safra-Piterman construction, the first step and the second step are swapped. Some optimization heuristics in [Joachim Klein and Christel Baier. Experiments with deterministic ω-automata for formulas of linear temporal logic. Theoretical Computer Science, '06] are also implemented. See SafraConstruction for available options. If SafraConstruction#O_HISTORY_TREE is enabled, Schewe's history trees will be used. See ScheweConverter.NBW2DPW(FSA). Note that some optimization heuristics are not implemented for history trees.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static boolean hack
    Uses the node name instead of the time of insertion to decide the older siblings similar to the Piterman's construction.

  • Field Details

    • hack

      public static boolean hack
      Uses the node name instead of the time of insertion to decide the older siblings similar to the Piterman's construction. In Safra's original construction, this variable should be false.

    • NBW2DRW

      public static FSA NBW2DRW​(FSA nbw, Properties options)
      Determinizes an NBW to an equivalent DRW by the Safra's construction with custom options.
      Parameters:
      nbw - an NBW to be determinized
      options - options for Safra's construction
      Returns:
      an equivalent DRW
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nbw is not an NBW
